Description: Handle and lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with two added white bands; exterior: glazed black on exterior surface of handle and around handle root.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see British Museum 1888,0601.750.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1150) (phase 2)
